items.title: Aging Pennsylvania Power Plant to Keep Running After Trump Order on Eve of Shutdown
items.description: A half-century-old Pennsylvania power plant fueled by oil and natural gas will keep running beyond its scheduled shutdown date following an order from the Trump administration just one day before it was due to retire. items.title: Heat Waves Are Changing Disease Dynamics in Unpredictable Ways, New Research Finds
items.description: Scientists have long known that changes in temperature can affect the risks and spread of infectious diseases by altering the biology and behavior of pathogens and their hosts, from butterflies to people. items.title: New Mexico Bans Release of Treated Oil and Gas Wastewater
items.description: After months of deliberation, the New Mexico Water Quality Control Commission on May 14 voted to prohibit any discharge of treated “produced water” from oil and gas extraction to ground and surface waters.  Produced water flows back to the surface during fracking and conventional oil and gas drilling and contains chemicals used in the extraction […]

items.title: Meta Strikes 20-Year Nuclear Power Deal With Constellation Energy
items.description: Facebook’s parent company Meta locked in 20 years of nuclear power on Tuesday from Constellation Energy to help meet the tech giant’s surging energy demand for artificial intelligence and its other power-intensive computing needs.  “Securing clean, reliable energy is necessary to continue advancing our AI ambitions,” Urvi Parekh, head of global energy at Meta, said […]

items.title: For Insurers, Smaller Weather Events Add Up to Big Losses as Climate Change Accelerates
items.description: Sunday marked the official start of the Atlantic hurricane season, a six-month stretch in which warm ocean waters and moist atmospheric conditions create the ideal foundation for tropical cyclones to form. items.title: Fearing Radioactive Waste, a Western Pennsylvania Community Fights to Stop a Landfill’s Re-Opening
items.description: For years, residents of Grove City, Pennsylvania, have fought to stop a decades-old landfill from resuming operations in their town.
